title: Companies Invite Young People to be "Partners for a Day"
summary: Guatemala City - More than 500 high school students participated today in the young entrepreneur training program "Socios por un Día" (Partners for a Day), organized by Empresarios Juveniles with support from Citi.
tag-1: Companies Invite Young People to be "Partners for a Day"
tag-3: Guatemala City – More than 500 high school students participated today in the young entrepreneur training program "Socios por un Día" (Partners for a Day), organized by Empresarios Juveniles with support from Citi.
tag-4: The program, now in its twelfth year, is designed to allow students to understand and experience a typical workday by shadowing a business manager, owner or executive.
tag-5: "The experience, which last a full workday, has been implemented at 60 companies that have a strong economic impact," noted José Herrera, Empresarios Juveniles' Executive Director in Guatemala. "The program is very useful for young people who are beginning their professional training. Participating in management is a great opportunity for them to learn skills and abilities they need for their successful incorporation into the workforce, appreciate the value of their university studies and be exposed to positive models of behavior."
tag-6: This year, 507 high school seniors participated in "Socios por un Día" at 60 Guatemalan companies ranging from banks, IT and telephone companies to restaurants, embassies, factories and stores. Managers and professional staff volunteered to mentor the students for a day.
tag-7: "This type of program helps reduce high school dropout rates and encourage students to continue their education at the college level. It motivates them to think big and develop important workplace skills," said Bernardo Chacín, General Manager of Citi Guatemala. "We support the 'Socios por un Día' program because it allows students to see how a business works and feel that there are opportunities in which they can participate."
tag-8: The program includes four parts: two teacher-led sessions before the workplace visit; the visit itself; and a follow-up session with the teacher.
tag-9: The theoretical portion focuses on workplace skills, resume writing, practice interviews, data analysis and interpretation, brainstorming, critical thinking, goal setting, oral and written communication, public speaking, self-assessment and teamwork. In addition, Manpower provides support and advice for a successful job search.
tag-10: "The program is high impact," Herrera concluded. "Students leave with business skills that help them think and develop a personal action plan for their future."
